message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.AI. 

The paper discusses bias in data gathering algorithms, which is a common problem in machine learning and statistics. The use of bandit algorithms and hypothesis testing suggests a focus on learning and decision-making, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The mention of differential privacy indicates a focus on privacy-preserving data analysis, which falls under the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR). The use of empirical means and p-values suggests a focus on statistical inference, which falls under the category of information theory (cs.IT). The mention of regret bounds suggests a focus on optimization, which falls under the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the use of contextual bandits suggests a focus on reinforcement learning, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
